titles.title: Honoring the career and research accomplishments of Frances E. Allen, the 2006 recipient of the A.M. Turing Award.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science and Technology.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Science and Technology
House Committee on Science and Technology

action.text: Ms. Woolsey moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 95.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 5/1/2007--Passed House amended. Honors the pioneering life work of Frances E. Allen in computer research and development. Salutes the Turing Award Committee for recognizing, through the selection of Frances Allen as the 2006 recipient of the A.M. Turing Award, that creative women have contributed mightily to the development of this important field.
